intro: Mutellina adonidifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice among gardeners in Mediterranean climates.
